newsitem.title: USA: Cerplex Group violates debt covenants.
newsitem.headline: Cerplex Group violates debt covenants.

text.p: The Cerplex Group Inc said Thursday it is currently in violation of certain covenants of its senior and subordinated debt agreements and is in talks to amend the loan deals.
It said it has received waivers through November 30 from lenders and added it previously disclosed the violations in filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
Cerplex also said it's tangible net worth has fallen below the minimum requirements for listing on the Nasdaq National Market, and it is talking with the NASD about the subject.
Earlier, Cerplex reported a $0.96 per share loss for the third quarter ended September 30 versus a loss of $1.91 a share one year ago.

In a statement Cerplex, a provider of service outsourcing, parts and logistics services, said third quarter losses reflect charges for asset write downs, higher interest expense and "a variety of other factors."
"During 1996, we began refocusing our operations on providing services which were less inventory intensive while downsizing or closing unprofitable operations," said William Klein, chief executive.
Cerplex also said collection problems with one bankrupt client and several other customers caused it to tighten credit standards and revise its target customer profile.
"Operational issues based on our former business model and other factors have impacted, and will in the near term continue to impact, our financial condition and results of operations," Klein said.

However, he noted in the last quarter the company has put its our new Ontario, Calif., hub on line. At that facility, Hewlett-Packard is the company's anchor customer. Cerplex also has begun operations at a new Louisville, Ky., hub.
It signed a work agreement with Digital Equipment Corp and is negotiating several other agreements with high quality customers that could provide over $25 million in business in fiscal 1997.
